content.en: Surgical Algorithms: Researchers have investigated various surgical management strategies for congenital heart conditions such as pulmonary atresia with ventricular septal defect and major aortopulmonary collateral arteries. They have found that using staged repair or a protocol-based approach, guided by algorithms, can successfully treat these conditions. Algorithms are also used to direct the choice of procedure for the Norwood procedure and to improve surgical results for pulmonary atresia with major aortopulmonary collateral arteries. Overall, the use of algorithms in surgical management has led to positive outcomes and improved patient care.
content.da: Kirurgiske algoritmer: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige kirurgiske behandlingsstrategier for medfødte hjertebetingelser såsom pulmonal atresi med ventrikelseptumdefekt og store aortopulmonale kollaterale arterier. De har fundet, at brugen af trinvis reparation eller en protokolbaseret tilgang, guidet af algoritmer, effektivt kan behandle disse tilstande. Algoritmer bruges også til at styre valget af procedure for Norwood-proceduren og til at forbedre kirurgiske resultater for pulmonal atresi med store aortopulmonale kollaterale arterier. Overordnet set har anvendelsen af algoritmer i kirurgisk behandling ført til positive resultater og forbedret patientpleje.
